title: How are the job opportunities in Canada after an MS? - Quora

response.answer_text: Canada is one of the most popular countries for international students to do masters. As per some major universities, reports indicate the percentage of international applications have increased to 10.7 compared to the last year. At the same time, American universities seeing a downfall in percentage. Many say it’s a trump effect, But I would say this is because the opportunities Canadian government provides to international students to immigrate. In November points based Express Entry Immigration System to give additional points to international students, who interested in permanent residency. Many universities in Canada offer a good amount of scholarships and grants to international students for financial stress-free education. The living costs also reasonable compared to the US. The only disadvantage for international students is the climatic conditions, temperatures as low as -25 degrees Celsius in winters along with snowfall and storms. Before you look for a job in Canada you should get a work permit under post-graduation work permit program (PGWP), keep in mind to apply for the work permit within 90 days after graduation. Job opportunities in Canada as per the field and average salary. Given below  Source: http://www.mbacrystalball.com/blog/2017/01/09/average-salary-ms-usa-canada-australia/ Hope it is helpful to you. All the best for your endeavours.

In a nutshell, an MS from Canada works out as a great package for those looking out for a good education and great work, that too in a country that qualifies as one of the top countries to live, year after year. Here are some average salary references for various jobs that MS graduates prefer to take up, as reported. Human Resource- C$52,000 Production Manager- C$60,000 Software Engineer- C$50,000 to C$95,000 Mechanical Engineering- C$57,000 Teacher- C$50,000 Here are some of the highest paying jobs in Canada, with estimated annual salaries. Mining and forestry manager: 108,000 CAD/yearOil and gas drilling supervisor: 79,000 CAD/yearAir traffic controller: 87,000 CAD/yearStatistician and actuaries: 89,000 CAD/yearEngineering manager: 94,000 CAD/yearPublic administration director: 99,000 CAD/yearPower systems operator: 84,000 CAD/yearHealth & community service manager: 100,000 CAD/yearMapping technologist: 68,000 CAD/yearSenior business manager: 97,000 CAD/yearAlso, the highest paying jobs in Canada by field of study are available. The amounts are calculated on a yearly basis. Dentistry: 99,706 CAD/yearPharmacy: 91,031 CAD/yearVeterinary medicine: 73,974 CAD/yearLaw: 72,981 CAD/yearMedicine: 65,333 CAD/yearTherapy & rehab: 65,000 CAD/yearEngineering: 63,564 CAD/yearComputer sciences: 63,462 CAD/yearNursing: 62,248 CAD/year(Refer here to know the Worst Masters Degree for Job) I hope it helps!

Canada is becoming one of the most popular study abroad destinations among international students. One of the major reasons behind this is its steadily growing economy and a small labor market that generates many job opportunities for students after completing their masters in Canada. Let us first get to know the best universities in Canada to consider for studying Masters in Canada. University of Waterloo, Concordia University, Victoria University, Humber College, University of New Brunswick, University of Prince Edward, University of Fraser Valley, and many more are some of the top universities and colleges in Canada to consider. These Canadian universities and colleges offer high-quality education with affordable tuition fees. Also, Canada allows international students to work part-time to support themselves financially. Students are allowed to work for 20 hours a week and work full time during their breaks and holidays! JOBS WITH GOOD DEMAND IN CANADA: The following are some of the highly paid and jobs with high demand in Canada: Primary Production ManagersAverage salary: C$69,653Physicians & DentistsAverage salary: C$142,000HR RecruitersSalary: C$44,000 to $52,000.NursesAverage salary: C$58,831.50Information security AnalysisAverage salary: C$68,411Marketing AnalysisAverage salary: C$60,000EngineersSalary: C$60,200 to $90,000Financial AnalystsAverage salary: C$56,128PhysiotherapistAverage salary: C$31,524EducationAverage salary: C$55,477Logistic WorkersAverage salary: C$28,744AccountantAverage salary: C$56,000Tourism and Hospitality ManagementAverage salary: C$66,000Office managers and administrative assistantsSalary: C$35,000 to $46,000I hope it Helps!

Your question is a bit vague. However I will try to answer. No degree can guarantee anyone for a job. Many people feel that a messy degree will guarantee a job, but it may actually price you out of an entry-level job. A Masters without any experience but she wouldn't disadvantage with other mattress can you have experience and it is eventual people with bachelors degrees because they cost less. Therefore, I don't recommend matches little program until least 2 to 3 years of experience, just in case you don't like the field, or if you want to be able to be competitive salary wise with your peers.  I am also aware that graduate degrees are away to become more competitive in the visa game. In United States advanced degree quadruples your chances of getting an H1B. However getting H1B doesn't mean that you're more competitive than another person know that you're guaranteed the job. You could bomb the job and be sent back.  .Pardon my errors in spelling and punctuation. I'm using speech to text software.

Canada has increases its target for next 3 years, 2019–2021, three year target plan,Canada’s goal of admitting more than a million new permanent residents by the end of 2021 is gaining new attention internationally. Under Canada’s 3 year immigration level plan, total immigration is expected to reach 350,000 new permanent residents in the year 2021. Canada multi year Immigration level plan: 2018- 3,10,000 2019- 3,30,800 2020- 3,41,000 2021- 3,50,000 So here you already can see that and can able to understand that If any country provide you visa on the permanent basis so obviously they will not provide you unemployment pay for the very long time, Hence Obviously there are vacancies and jobs available, that’s the reason they invited you so many candidates who are eligible according to the eligibility criteria of the Express Entry and also to the candidates whose profile or occupation are available in Canada (i.e NOC). As per the current latest news Canada’s private sector job vacancy rate reached another record in the first three months of 2019 The federation reports a total of 435,000 jobs sat vacant for at least four months across Canada during the first quarter of 2019, which amounted to a job vacancy rate of 3.3 per cent. Canada saw a record 106,500 jobs added in April and another 27,700 jobs added in May, and unemployment in the country is at its lowest point in more than 40 years.Quebec, British Columbia and Ontario had the highest job vacancy rates among Canada's provinces So if you are interested to migrate to Canada your dream destination to secure your and your family future and want to know about your occupation availability then Kindly contact us here at Roundworld Immigration, We will be happy to assist you

I can't comment on the computer sector specifically, but I believe it is going strong here in Canada. I have many friends from university who came as international students on student visas. All of them have been able to stay in Canada, found jobs of some type within a year of graduation, and are now permanent residents. So from that perspective, I would say that you do have good chances of becoming employed here after your MS as long as you are open. For my friends, they didn't get jobs in their field of choice at first and are working from the bottom up. I know one person so far who has found a job in her field. To be honest, its not unusual and that's how most people in this country have to do it after they graduate. I would look at the website http://www.jobbank.gc.ca look at the area of the country you are interested and look at job postings in the category you want. The employers sometimes post what the salary offered is so you can get ideas.

What kind of MS? It should be no different from any other job opportunity for MS wherever you are. Your only concern should be how to get to Canada if you are from overseas. For this, you have two options to consider: Pursue the migration process. This is quite lengthy and the requirements are rigid. Many who apply get denied but your chances are higher through a fiancé VISA or through a relative’s help. Once you get there, you may start applying for a job.Find a company which will be willing to help process your migration. Although not quite common, there are still companies which will assist applicants overseas towards acquiring a work VISA. Some may even fund a postgraduate program. There are websites you can find leads for this such as Monster or even LinkedIn. You may also search through job agencies which offer the option to find employer for you in exchange for a free which may either be paid during the job hunt process or after you found one via a salary deduction scheme.The latter may be a better option.

Many answers are purely marketing for overseas consultancies. I live here and have first hand experience but still limited as it is one person's experience. Canada has plenty of opportunities for smart people graduating from top universities. If not, then you have good chances if you are in IT and an above average student with preferably some experience in your home country. If none of the above, you can still try to get PR using Canadian experience class, by working in some job, as you have 3 years of post graduate work permit. This is actually how a lot of people who go to very average and below average colleges get PR. But the fact is Canada has very few white collar jobs and the competition is tough because there are many PRs being given to outsiders who usually have more experience and skills than students. So unless you are employable in your own country, don't expect you will be employable here without strong efforts.

Thank you so much for asking to answer Initially there a few behind the screen process. US specifically monitors students, behavior, attitude etc. (its all about homeland security) while there isn't such things in Canada. In US if you belong to specific countries you will automatically drafted into a separate set of applicants. This is more political (measures to curb illegal activities). If you are from Iran it will be a little different but if you are a Jap or Indian it will be much more different (hope you get the point).  When it comes to science and tec. all gets equal opportunity. We have so many Indian IITians working in US defense projects outside USA like in Netherlands, Turkey etc. so US-Internatinal students are all put together in a same group and they are preferred only based on their commitment and nothing else. Canada is not a tech blooming spot. so its always hard to find a proper placement. Their education laws and opportunities are more like Indian and Chinese. So options in Canada are not much different from India. Good Luck

It’s very hard to find a job not because you are not qualified but people are afraid the unknown. Probably so many people are uneducated about the disease and would rather have someone that is 100% physically and 110% cognitive ability plus willing to give everything they got compared to some who has dificulties in everyday activities. It’s sad but true I get discriminated against all the time. Even though I can do my job just well as the other employees. If you have a disability pleasers just try most people can do what ever the job is Most of the time Of course there are always exceptions Good luck

finding jobs in such country should not be a problem if you have the right skills.If an employer can find a local or Permanent resident candidate having same qualification as yours,he would rather pick the local candidate,as far he is considered ,offering jobs to immigrants will cost him more(for visa,insurance and other stuff).So do the research on the job markets in Canada before quitting India. Don't blindly believe any  education consultant.Its all business for them

If you do an MS from a prestigious university in Canada with decent CGPA in the fields of science, information technology, engineering etc. then you stand a much better chance to grab a desired placement for yourself! Canada anyways offers you to stay back for another 3 years after MS under post study work visa. In that period if you decide so, even application for permanent residency can be made which normally takes upto 15 to 18 months to process. Though most parts of Canada is having extremely cold climatic conditions, international students prefer locations for example, Toronto, Vancouver, Montreal, Calgary to stay and work after graduating from universities. Hope this helps!!

A2A. Zero to infinite opportunity. Unless you made a name for yourself and the companies cant wait to hire you/give you a job, it is upto you to get a job. The job prospect is not equal for every sector. There are multiple factors that determine whether you will get a job or not One of the best thing about Canada is that it provides you the chance to work in any field after graduation. So, while you look for jobs, you can be involved in part time work.
A2A. It purely depends on which university you are considering.  Generally top universities have very high ratio of students getting job irrespective of their geographic location. :)
It depends in what field, how much experience you have and where you got the MS. One from Asia will rarely be looked at by Canadian employers.

Well it depend on many factors like course,university,place etc.Choose top university which are transparent about placement and can offer good Co op and choose course that have a good demand in the Industry.The place has a great role in getting a job for example Atlantic Canada are not so populated so hard to get a job and your skill will definitely matters.
